CVE.summary: Mozilla Firefox before 3.5.17 and 3.6.x before 3.6.14, and SeaMonkey before 2.0.12, does not properly handle certain recursive eval calls, which makes it easier for remote attackers to force a user to respond positively to a dialog question, as demonstrated by a question about granting privileges.

vFeed.Product: vFeed - The Correlated Vulnerability and Threat Database
vFeed.Author: NJ OUCHN

Oval.title: RHSA-2011:0310: firefox security and bug fix update (Critical)
ELSA-2011:0310: firefox security and bug fix update (Critical)

Mozilla Firefox before 3.5.17 and 3.6.x before 3.6.14, and SeaMonkey before 2.0.12, does not properly handle certain recursive eval calls, which makes it easier for remote attackers to force a user to respond positively to a dialog question, as demonstrated by a question about granting privileges.
